004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem;
009import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
010
011/**
012 * This class provides an easy way to link commands to OI inputs.
013 *
014 * <p>It is very easy to link a button to a command. For instance, you could link the trigger button
015 * of a joystick to a "score" command.
016 *
017 * <p>This class represents a subclass of Trigger that is specifically aimed at buttons on an
018 * operator interface as a common use case of the more generalized Trigger objects. This is a simple
019 * wrapper around Trigger with the method names renamed to fit the Button object use.
020 *
021 * <p>This class is provided by the OldCommands VendorDep
022 */
023public class Button extends Trigger {
024  /**
025   * Default constructor; creates a button that is never pressed (unless {@link Button#get()} is
026   * overridden).
027   */
028  public Button() {}
029
030  /**
031   * Creates a new button with the given condition determining whether it is pressed.
032   *
033   * @param isPressed returns whether or not the trigger should be active
034   */
035  public Button(BooleanSupplier isPressed) {
036    super(isPressed);
037  }
038
039  /**
040   * Starts the given command whenever the button is newly pressed.
041   *
042   * @param command the command to start
043   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
044   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
045   */
046  public Button whenPressed(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
047    whenActive(command, interruptible);
048    return this;
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Starts the given command whenever the button is newly pressed. The command is set to be
053   * interruptible.
054   *
055   * @param command the command to start
056   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
057   */
058  public Button whenPressed(final Command command) {
059    whenActive(command);
060    return this;
061  }
062
063  /**
064   * Runs the given runnable whenever the button is newly pressed.
065   *
066   * @param toRun the runnable to run
067   * @param requirements the required subsystems
068   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
069   */
070  public Button whenPressed(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
071    whenActive(toRun, requirements);
072    return this;
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Constantly starts the given command while the button is held.
077   *
078   * <p>{@link Command#schedule(boolean)} will be called repeatedly while the button is held, and
079   * will be canceled when the button is released.
080   *
081   * @param command the command to start
082   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
083   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
084   */
085  public Button whileHeld(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
086    whileActiveContinuous(command, interruptible);
087    return this;
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * Constantly starts the given command while the button is held.
092   *
093   * <p>{@link Command#schedule(boolean)} will be called repeatedly while the button is held, and
094   * will be canceled when the button is released. The command is set to be interruptible.
095   *
096   * @param command the command to start
097   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
098   */
099  public Button whileHeld(final Command command) {
100    whileActiveContinuous(command);
101    return this;
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Constantly runs the given runnable while the button is held.
106   *
107   * @param toRun the runnable to run
108   * @param requirements the required subsystems
109   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
110   */
111  public Button whileHeld(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
112    whileActiveContinuous(toRun, requirements);
113    return this;
114  }
115
116  /**
117   * Starts the given command when the button is first pressed, and cancels it when it is released,
118   * but does not start it again if it ends or is otherwise interrupted.
119   *
120   * @param command the command to start
121   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
122   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
123   */
124  public Button whenHeld(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
125    whileActiveOnce(command, interruptible);
126    return this;
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Starts the given command when the button is first pressed, and cancels it when it is released,
131   * but does not start it again if it ends or is otherwise interrupted. The command is set to be
132   * interruptible.
133   *
134   * @param command the command to start
135   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
136   */
137  public Button whenHeld(final Command command) {
138    whileActiveOnce(command, true);
139    return this;
140  }
141
142  /**
143   * Starts the command when the button is released.
144   *
145   * @param command the command to start
146   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
147   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
148   */
149  public Button whenReleased(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
150    whenInactive(command, interruptible);
151    return this;
152  }
153
154  /**
155   * Starts the command when the button is released. The command is set to be interruptible.
156   *
157   * @param command the command to start
158   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
159   */
160  public Button whenReleased(final Command command) {
161    whenInactive(command);
162    return this;
163  }
164
165  /**
166   * Runs the given runnable when the button is released.
167   *
168   * @param toRun the runnable to run
169   * @param requirements the required subsystems
170   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
171   */
172  public Button whenReleased(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
173    whenInactive(toRun, requirements);
174    return this;
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Toggles the command whenever the button is pressed (on then off then on).
179   *
180   * @param command the command to start
181   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
182   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
183   */
184  public Button toggleWhenPressed(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
185    toggleWhenActive(command, interruptible);
186    return this;
187  }
188
189  /**
190   * Toggles the command whenever the button is pressed (on then off then on). The command is set to
191   * be interruptible.
192   *
193   * @param command the command to start
194   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
195   */
196  public Button toggleWhenPressed(final Command command) {
197    toggleWhenActive(command);
198    return this;
199  }
200
201  /**
202   * Cancels the command when the button is pressed.
203   *
204   * @param command the command to start
205   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
206   */
207  public Button cancelWhenPressed(final Command command) {
208    cancelWhenActive(command);
209    return this;
210  }
211}
